definition: not divided/irrespective/not distinguishing between
(negative prefix)/not/no
part/share/ingredient/component

to divide/to separate/to distribute/to allocate/to distinguish (good and bad)/part or subdivision/fraction/one tenth (of certain units)/unit of length equivalent to 0.33 cm/minute (unit of time)/minute (angular measurement unit)/a point (in sports or games)/0.01 yuan (unit of money)
day and night/round-the-clock
not distinguishing red-green or black-white (idiom)/not to distinguish between right and wrong
pinyin: bu4 fen1 qing1 hong2 zao4 bai2

definition: to make no distinction between what's one's own and what's another's (idiom)/to share everything/to be on very intimate terms
unable to determine victory or defeat (idiom); evenly matched/to come out even/to tie/to draw
unable to distinguish right and wrong (idiom)
can't tell black from white (idiom); unable to distinguish wrong from right
well-matched/equally matched
not distinguishing black or white (idiom); not to distinguish between right and wrong
not to know one's place
lit. unable to distinguish eldest brother from second brother (idiom); they are all equally excellent/nothing to choose between them
to not be able to distinguish who's winning
indiscriminate
equally matched/not much to distinguish who is stronger
never move your four limbs, can't distinguish the five crops (idiom); living as a parasite
pinyin: si4 ti3 bu4 qin2 , wu3 gu3 bu4 fen1

sentences.english: It was tight. so ti lasted a long time .
sentences.chinese: 两队不分胜负，所以持续了很长一段时间。

sentences.english: Lens ark and under the ark of perfect collocation, let beauty regardless of the dayside and night.
sentences.chinese: 镜柜与下柜的完美搭配，让美丽不分昼与夜。

sentences.english: These three traits are what make religion and ritual such good bedfellows.
sentences.chinese: 这三种特征使宗教和仪式不分彼此。

sentences.english: Third, consumption is no less volatile than output in Mexico.
sentences.chinese: 最后，墨西哥的消费量的起伏与生产量不分伯仲。

sentences.english: I think about you day and night.
Baby, , as long as we keep each other in our heart, our love for each other will never apart.
sentences.chinese: 只要我们将彼此放在心中，我们的爱就就永不分离。

sentences.english: These pictures are collected without choice.
sentences.chinese: 这些画是不分好坏搜集来的。

sentences.english: The two teams tied(with each other).
And in our bound partition never part.
sentences.chinese: 在我们的范围里分隔永不分离。

sentences.english: He told her he loved her, and they were inseparable.
sentences.chinese: 他向她表白了他的痴情，说他们永不分离。

sentences.english: Safety is the wheel of happiness, but it will never separate.
sentences.chinese: 安全是幸福的车轮，不转却永不分离。

sentences.english: Good programmers think about their work 24/7.
sentences.chinese: 好的程序员不分昼夜在思考完善自己的项目。

sentences.english: Sometimes I want to take you swallow, never to be parted.
sentences.chinese: 有时候我想把你吞下去，永不分离。

sentences.english: In principle a volcano can erupt at any time, day and night.
sentences.chinese: 原则上说，火山随时都会爆发，不分昼夜。

sentences.english: However when they leave the home and go downstairs, then there is 'no difference between you and me'.
sentences.chinese: 但是从家里拿下楼去反而“不分你我”了。

definition: noble and lowly/high versus low social hierarchy of ruler to people, father to son, husband to wife in Confucianism
close and distant, rich and poor (idiom); everyone/all possible relations
to distinguish (between different things)/to make distinctions clear
to be all the same way (literary)
to treat everyone equally favorably (idiom); not to discriminate between people
poor and rich
to pay no attention to/to disregard/to ignore/to let go unpunished/to let off
as rivers Jing and Wei separate clearly (idiom)/to be entirely different
to turn upside down/to reverse/back to front/confused/deranged/crazy
close and distant (relatives)
completely/sharply (differing)
the rights and wrongs of a matter (idiom)

height/altitude (aviation)/pitch (music)/ups and downs (success or failure)/whether sth is right or wrong/comparative strength, weight, depth, stature/(spoken interjection) anyway, whatever/eventually, in the end
whatever/no matter what (who, how etc)/regardless of/not to discuss
older and younger/seniority
superior and subordinate/social ranking
